_header: Set and save if thou will have

BLAdd22720.First Lines: [...]if thow will haue[...]te leue and craue…
BLAdd22720.Last Lines:
…Werke wysely and sey but fewOut thyne hed loke thou neuer
                    hew
BLAdd22720.Note:
The poor condition of the manuscript means that the first lines are
                    incomplete.

BLAdd37049.Note: Lines 1-4 in a series of distiches: see 917.
BLAdd37049.Editions:
Doty,  Brant Lee,
                        ed.  
             “An Edition of British Museum MS Additional 37049: a Religious
                Miscellany.” 
         Diss. Michigan State, 1969: 475.

BLHar116.Transcription:
Kepe & saue & þu schall haueffrest & lene &
                    þu schall craueWalow & wast & þu schall wa[u]e
BLHar116.Note:
Three lines monorhyming, added to flyleaf by a hand of the
                    fifteenth-sixteenth century.
BLHar116.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas,  and  James Orchard Halliwell-Phillipps, eds.  
             Reliquiae Antiquae.
         2 vols. London: Smith, 1845: 1.316.

NLS1931.First Lines:
Sette and saue yf thow wyll haueWaste and wante leue and
                    crave…
NLS1931.Last Lines:
…Do that thi dewe is kepe þe owt of presfor who do
                    medelethe leste leuys best in pes
NLS1931.Note:
Follows 4800 as if part
                    of same work.
NLS1931.Facsimiles:
Hardman,  Phillipa. 
             The Heege Manuscript: A Facsimile of National Library of Scotland MS
                Advocates 19.3.1.
         Leeds Texts and Monographs, n.s. 16. Leeds: School of English,
            2000.
